Utilities

Class PlayerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.PlayerState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PlayerState>

    public class PlayerState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PlayerState>
    Player state keeps player data and high score list.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kyle Jon Aure
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getUserName

        public java.lang.String getUserName()
        Return this player's User Name.
        Returns:
        String representation of this player's user name.
        require
        This player must be initialized and have a User Name set.
        ensure
        User name will be returned as a string.

      • setUserName

        public void setUserName(java.lang.String userName)
        Set this player's user name
        Parameters:
        userName - String new user name for this player
        require
        This player must be initialized.
        ensure
        This player's user name will be set/reset.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Return this player's score.
        Returns:
        Integer this player's score.
        require
        This player must be initialized and have a score set.
        ensure
        Score will be returned as an integer.

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int score)
        Set the score for this player and update this player's position in the high score list.
        Parameters:
        score - Integer new score for this player
        require
        this player must be initialized.
        ensure
        this player's score will be updated and their position on the high score list will be changed if necessary.

      • getHighScores

        public static java.util.ArrayList<PlayerState> getHighScores()
        Get high score list.
        Returns:
        ArrayList high scores returned.
        require
        High score list is static and can be null. Check that scores exist before using.
        ensure
        Most current high scores list will be returned and be in order.

      • saveHighScores

        public void saveHighScores()
        Save high scores
        require
        Saving will override data. Before calling this method make sure this is what you want to do.
        ensure
        Current high score list (static) will be saved in the default location and override the last save.

        public static void loadHighScores()
